chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Neil Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Neil Huber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Neil Huber was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to sign up for probation while in jail.
- 70 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Payable through probation on Count 2 in St. Croix County Case 22CF161.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Payable through probation on Count 2 in St. Croix County Case 22CF161.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with C.L.S.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete all programming.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
- Subject to random and regular testing.

08:35 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: A.W. Schutte, DF: Christopher Neil Huber appeared from jail. Atty Schutte states there is an agreement. Atty Rockow recites joint agreement no restitution is requested.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads NC to Ct 2- Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent in 22CF161. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 22CF161. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 & 3 with prejudice in 22CF161.   Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 2 in 22CF161

S/W 3 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $268.00.  To be pd through probation
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
- DE's payment plan for Atty Schutte to be suspended until released from Jail.  Clerk to set review every 30 days to check status of DE, if released, DE given 30 days before payment plan resumes. 
- Absolute Sobriety
- No Contact with Victim, owner of vehicle
- Complete all programming 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Maintain full time employment
- Subject to random and regular testing
- Sign up for probation while in jail

- 70 Days Jail Credit against ultimate sentence

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office/VW. mw
Preliminary hearing on March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:23 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and Derek Sanders for today, DF: Christopher Neil Huber appeared from jail. Unknown if DE qualifies for PD. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Rockow states DE has outstanding warrants throughout the state of WI and MN. Waive reading. Reserve pre-plea rights. Bond Arguments. Court orders bond. Court may consider bail reduction if po hold is lifted. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
